chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Davian Dontrell Woelful Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to Count 2 and to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Full-time work/school.
Work on obtaining a HS diploma/GED/HSED.

Obtain a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA sample.
Court waived all costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) due to a finding of indigency.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davian Dontrell Woelful Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Davian Dontrell Woelful Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Davian Dontrell Woelful Jr.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  State has complied with victim notification law.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 MONTHS, CONCURRENT to Count 2 and to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 MONTHS, CONCURRENT to Count 1 and to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.

Court finds the defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Full-time work/school.
- Complete 40 hours of community service.  
- Obtain a valid driver's license. 
- Work on obtaining a HS diploma/GED/HSED. 

Court waived all costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) due to a finding of indigency. 

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Davian Dontrell Woelful Jr appeared by video.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Davian Dontrell Woelful Jr.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned to branch 40 for an in person hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Davian Dontrell Woelful not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in Court for a status conference.  Defense requested a plea and sentencing date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Davian Dontrell Woelful not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davian Dontrell Woelful in court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw; both appear by video.  Defendant Davian Dontrell Woelful in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case remains calendared for status 04/12/2022 at 1:30pm. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.

Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was not set for a preliminary hearing in CCAP after the initial appearance. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Davian Dontrell Woelful in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Davian Dontrell Woelful in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Case adjourned to Branch PH. Preliminary hearing scheduled for MArch 9th, 2022, at 8:30 am. Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/9/22 @ 2:30p
